cucopy package¶

cucopy.config module¶

cucopy.currency module¶

class cucopy.currency.Currency(recording_date: str, value: float = 1, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Currency class

The Currency class provides the following functionality:

  • It provides the basic structure of a value, meaning, it stores information about its dimension (i.e. the actual monetary value), its recording date and its unit.

  • In addition to the most common scientific number notations (K, M, B, T), it is also possible to store a currency with a custom notation and value.

  • It allows for easy adjustment for inflation of the provided value, in terms of taking a base value from date A and calculating its worth at date B.

The parameters stored in a Currency object refer to:

  • the date, at which the value, which is to be adjusted for inflation, was recorded (recording_date)

  • the actual value to be adjusted (value)

  • the scientific notation of the value (notation; e.g. ‘K’ for 1.000, ‘M’ for 1.000.000, etc.)

  • the currency in which the value was recorded (currency; for now: EURO)

When creating a Currency object with a custom notation, following parameters are added:

  • the scientific notation of the new unit (notation_pow; the value of a unit is determined as follows: 1E[notation_pow]).

Following parameters are also stored in an instance of this class, but only after initialization:

  • the target date, meaning, the date, to which adjust the value to (target_date)

  • the parser, which handles the extraction of CPIs from a table (parser)

EUR = 'eur'¶
YYYY_MM_DD = '%Y-%m-%d'¶

Function for getting the inflation-corrected value.

Returns

the base value adjusted for inflation

Function for getting the purchasing power of a value.

Returns

the base value’s remaining purchasing power

Return type

float

set_parser(path=None, delim=';', language='de', classification='all')¶

Function for setting the parser.

Parameters

  • path (string) – the path at which the csv file containing the recorded cpi values is stored

  • delim (string) – the csv delimiter, by which the values are separated

  • language (string) – the language, in which the csv file is stored. Only needed, when no custom csv file is provided via path.

set_target_date(date_str)¶

Function for setting the date, to which should be adjusted to.

Parameters

date_str (string) – the target date, as a string

classmethod unique_notation(recording_date: str, notation: str, notation_pow: int, value: float = 1, **kwargs)¶

Decorator for creating a Currency class instance with a custom notation.

Required arguments: :param recording_date: the date, at which a value was recorded :type recording_date: string

Parameters

  • notation (string) – the new and unique symbol/ string, by which the notation should be referred to

  • notation_pow (int) – the scientific notation of the new unit. The value of a unit is determined as follows: 1E[notation_pow]

Default arguments: :param value: the monetary value. The default value is 1 :type value: float

Parameters

currency (string) – the currency in which the value was recorded. The default is ‘Eur’.

cucopy.manage module¶

cucopy.manage.download_data(timeseries_classification, language='de')¶

Function for downloading a timeseries containing the most recent cpi data from the Deutsche Bundesbank in either german (‘de’) or english (‘en’) formatting.

Parameters

  • timeseries_classification (string) – the timeseries’ statistics classification id.

  • language (string) – the language the timeseries should be formatted in.

cucopy.manage.main()¶

cucopy.parser module¶

class cucopy.parser.Parser(**kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Parser class

The Parser class provides the following functionality:

  • It parses a csv file in its corresponding language and extracts the CPI value from a given date.

The parameters stored in a Parser object refer to:

  • the language, in which the csv file was created (language; useful for choosing the correct delimiter)

  • the delimiter used for separating the values in the file (delimiter; if no language was provided)

  • the id of the csv file as outlined by the Deutsche Bundesbank (classification: https://www.bundesbank.de/dynamic/action/de/statistiken/zeitreihen-datenbanken/zeitreihen-datenbank/759778/759778?listId=www_s300_mb09_07)

  • the proper locale module, derived from the specified language (locale_module)

get_cpi(date: datetime.datetime)¶

Function for extracting the cpi from the Parser object’s dataframe (self.df).

Parameters

date_str (string) – the target date, as a string

classmethod specified_path(path: str, delimiter: str)¶

Decorator for creating a Parser class instance with a custom path to a csv file.

Required arguments: :param path: the path to the custom .csv-file. :type path: string

Parameters

delimiter (string) – the delimiter used in a .csv-file, important for parsing the file using pandas.

Module contents¶

CuCoPy is a Python library for adjusting euro values for inflation.

CuCoPy
